post.body: that's a title i'm less familiar with - googling/reading about it now :)
it's a neat list - it's always surprising to see what gets green-lit and what doesn't initially
agreed - WP-Print is hands down the best print plugin. Lester Chan pumps out some pretty useful stuff for WP, doesn't he?
and if comments on your site worked, I'd correct that pseudo-vocabulary lesson re: "ironic"
for someone who lamented "journalism lite," seeing your re-run about Kevin Johnson and Michelle Rhee was a bit... ironic
not a problem. were they shocked when they realized they'd been fake-teaching all these years? perhaps relieved?!?
authentic instruction, as opposed to all the inauthentic, disingenuous, made up play-instruction? :)
you know, because all the thinking we do now is uncritical, 20th century and fake ;)
yep - words I'd like to hear less of in 2009: critical thinking, authentic, 21st century skills
Spanish? why stop there? check out Google Site Translator from Google Gadgets: http://twurl.nl/2i8m32
education writer/blogger Joanne Jacobs is on Twitter - parents, teachers, policy wonks, etc. - toss her a follow: @JoanneLeeJacobs #tcot
Kreme uf ANGREE soup: http://twurl.nl/dy38w0
Famous books rejected multiple times: http://twurl.nl/cav3sj
Pakistani Taliban threatens to blow up girls' schools if not closed by Jan 15th: http://twurl.nl/plqanu #tcot
thanks to @sewbusymommy , my 1,000th follower :)
"Obama's Amazingly Un-Amazing Education Secretary" - interesting piece by Greg Forster: http://twurl.nl/5kxs46 #tcot
Man gets killed in Wal-Mart shopping rush? Outrage. Ugandan rebels hack to death 200 villagers? Not a peep. http://twurl.nl/2o3hyo #tcot
"Should the Obama Generation Drop Out?" by Charles Murray in the NYTimes: http://twurl.nl/yswdyu #tcot
Must be that the education people aren't back to the grind yet - I haven't seen the word "authentic" in almost 15 minutes
"A tale of two pundits: Sowell v. Huffington," from Roger's Rules at PajamasMedia: http://twurl.nl/pdzyej #tcot
